title: Scott Morrison - Wikipedia
snippet: The Speaker of the House of Representatives, Tony Smith, had determined that there was a prima facie case and, in voting down the motion, the Morrison government became the first government since Federation to refuse a referral from the Speaker. This decision attracted significant attention and criticism from the media.

title: Scott Morrison | Biography, Education, & Previous Offices | Britannica
snippet: As the pandemic ebbed, Morrison and Australians were faced with another catastrophic weather-related event.

title: Scott Morrison | Research Starters | EBSCO Research
snippet: As prime minister, he led Australia through significant events, including the devastating bushfire season of 2019-2020 and the COVID-19 pandemic, but faced considerable criticism for his handling of these crises and internal party conflicts.

title: Scott Morrison | CNAS
snippet: During Mr. Morrison’s term as Prime Minister Australian defence spending increased to more than 2% of GDP and he updated Australia’s defence strategy and security posture to address an increasingly assertive China.

title: Scott Morrison: Rise and fall of Australia's divisive pandemic leader
snippet: Mr Morrison negotiated a landmark defence pact with the US and the UK in 2021, called Aukus. The agreement - widely seen as a joint effort to counter China's growing military might - re-aligns Australia more closely with the US.
